summary: Most federal employees worked remotely during the COVID-19 pandemic, leaving many federal facilities underutilized. The pandemic significantly altered the government's office space needs and has it reconsidering the size and scale of its real property portfolio. The General Services Administration sees this as an opportunity to restructure that portfolio and is taking steps to make cost-effective decisions by collecting data on how often employees report...
title: Federal Real Property: GSA Could Further Support Agencies' Post-Pandemic Planning for Office Space Use
